title: The human dystrophin gene requires 16 hours to be transcribed and is cotranscriptionally spliced

tldr.text: Investigation of the largest known gene, the human dystrophin gene, found that transcripts are spliced at the 5′ end before transcription is complete providing strong evidence for cotranscriptional splicing.
